title: At least 23 people dead after fire at nightclub in Goa, India
byline: At least 23 people have been killed after a fire at a nightclub in Goa, India.

title: Myanmar military aircraft carrying relief supplies arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: A Myanmar military aircraft carrying relief supplies has arrived at the Katunayake Air Force Base to support Sri Lankans affected by the recent adverse weather conditions.

title: New hotline introduced for public to report essential service disruptions
byline: The Office of the Commissioner General of Essential Services (CGES) has officially introduced a dedicated Speed Dial Number – ‘1904’ to rapidly report complaints and difficulties related to the accessibility of essential services across the country.

title: Major reservoirs still spilling; Reconstruction works underway – Irrigation Dept
byline: The Irrigation Department’s 30 main reservoirs and more than 39 medium-sized reservoirs are currently spilling, Director of Irrigation (Water Management) H.M.P.S.D. Herath said.

title: ‘Peaky Blinders’ movie first look: Cillian Murphy returns as Netflix sets theatrical and streaming release in March
byline: Netflix has unveiled teaser art for “The Immortal Man,” the upcoming “Peaky Blinders” film which will serve as a continuation of the hit crime drama series.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: The Northeast monsoon condition is gradually establishing over the island, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Death toll from devastating Indonesia floods passes 900
byline: The death toll in Indonesia from recent flooding has passed 900, with hundreds still missing.

title: Swiss disaster relief aircraft arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: An aircraft carrying a consignment of disaster relief aid from Switzerland arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake, this morning (06).

title: India backs Sri Lanka’s post-cyclone recovery efforts
byline: A top Indian diplomat on Saturday briefed Sri Lankan corporate leaders about New Delhi’s “response and continued commitment” to the cyclone-hit island nation in its resurgence from the disaster that has claimed over 600 lives so far.

title: President briefs Malwathu Chapter Mahanayake Thera on disaster relief programmes
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake visited the Malwathu Maha Viharaya this morning (06) and paid respects to the Mahanayake Thera of the Malwathu Chapter, Most Venerable Thibbatuwawe Sri Sumangala Thera.

title: Sri Lanka’s death toll from Cyclone Ditwah crosses 600
byline: The Disaster Management Center (DMC) has reported that the number of deaths caused by Cyclonic Storm Ditwah and adverse weather conditions across all 25 districts of Sri Lanka has risen to 607.

title: Landslide evacuation warning issued to several areas further extended
byline: The ‘Level-3’ (Red) landslide evacuation warning issued to multiple areas in five districts has been extended.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that the Northeast monsoon condition is gradually establishing over the island.

title: Approval of local and foreign no-pay leave for public officials suspended
byline: The Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Councils, and Local Government has announced the immediate suspension of approving local and foreign no-pay leave (unpaid leave) for all public sector officials.

title: Deadline extended for filing income tax returns after Cyclone impact
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has extended the deadline for filing Income Tax Returns for the Year of Assessment 2024/2025 to 31 December 2025, in response to disruptions caused by Cyclonic Storm Ditwah and adverse weather conditions affecting several regions of Sri Lanka.

title: Police issue safety advisory for pilgrims visiting Sri Pada
byline: The Police Headquarters has issued a safety advisory regarding the protection of pilgrims visiting Sri Pada (Adam’s Peak), following concerns over geo-instability along one of the main access routes.

title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery’s studios, streaming unit for $72 billion
byline: Netflix on Friday agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery’s TV, film studios and streaming division for $72 billion, a deal that would hand control of one of Hollywood’s most prized and oldest assets to the streaming pioneer.

title: India caps airfares as IndiGo crisis leaves hundreds stranded for fifth day
byline: India capped airfares on Saturday as hundreds of passengers gathered outside Bengaluru and Mumbai airports after IndiGo cancelled 385 flights on the fifth day of a crisis at the country’s biggest airline that has crippled air travel.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Tamil Nadu dispatches relief supplies to Sri Lanka
byline: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M K Stalin on Saturday flagged off a ship laden with relief material including 300 MT rice to the cyclone ‘Ditwah’-ravaged Sri Lanka.

title: One person killed in shooting in Dehiwala
byline: A 34-year-old person has been shot and killed near the ‘A Quarters Ground’ area in Dehiwala this evening (6), police said.

title: Former UK doctor charged with sexual offences against 38 patients
byline: British prosecutors on Friday announced charges against a former doctor for multiple alleged sexual offences involving patients, including child sexual offences.

title: Ninth Indian emergency relief aircraft arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: The ninth consignment of humanitarian assistance from India, dispatched under India’s “Operation Sagar Bandhu”, reached the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake this afternoon (06).

title: Rehan Jayawickreme resigns from SJB
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) organizer for the Weligama electorate and former Mayor of Weligama, Rehan Jayawickreme, has announced his resignation from the party.

title: Suspect wanted for multiple murders nabbed with ‘Ice’ in Thalawathugoda
byline: A suspect linked to several major criminal offences including murders has been arrested following a raid carried out by officers of the Thalangama Police Station.

title: Sweden wants to strip organised crime leaders of citizenship
byline: The Swedish government on Friday proposed changes to the constitution that would allow revoking the citizenship of some criminal gang leaders, as part of its work to combat widespread organised crime.

title: Death toll from adverse weather rises to 618 with 209 still missing
byline: The death toll due to the adverse weather conditions experienced in the country over the past few days has climbed to 618 as at 8.00 p.m. today (06), according to the Disaster Management Center (DMC).

title: 71 reservoirs overflow; DMC warns of minor flooding in Malwathu Oya
byline: The Irrigation Department reports that a total of 71 reservoirs, including 36 major reservoirs, are currently spilling.

title: Putin, Modi agree to expand and widen India-Russia trade, strengthen friendship
byline: Russian President Vladimir Putin offered India uninterrupted fuel supplies on Friday, eliciting a cautious response even as he and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi agreed to expand trade and defence ties between countries with decades-old ties.

title: Navy seizes over 70 kg of narcotics from abandoned boat in Kalpitiya
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has seized 63.5 kilograms of crystal methamphetamine (Ice) and over 14.5 kilograms of heroin, concealed in three fertilizer sacks, during an operation off the Kalpitiya coast last night (05).

title: Five injured after lorry collides with two cars on Marine Drive
byline: Five individuals were injured and hospitalized following a road accident on Marine Drive in Bambalapitiya at around 2:30 AM today (06).

title: UK increases humanitarian aid to £1M for Sri Lanka following Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The British High Commission in Colombo says that the United Kingdom (UK) is stepping up support for Sri Lanka after Cyclone Ditwah, increasing UK humanitarian aid to a total of £1 million ($1.32 million).

title: Sri Lanka’s death toll from adverse weather climbs to 611
byline: The death toll due to the adverse weather conditions experienced in the country over the past few days has climbed to 611, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) has confirmed.

title: Shooting at South African bar leaves 11 dead, including three children
byline: At least 11 people were killed on Saturday including a three-year-old boy, after gunshots were fired at an illegal bar in the South African city of Pretoria, police said, adding that a manhunt was launched for three suspects who were not identified.

title: Chinese companies donate Rs. 19.5 million for Sri Lanka’s disaster relief
byline: The Chinese Chamber of Commerce in Sri Lanka has extended financial assistance amounting to LKR 19.5 million, made possible through the generous contributions of Chinese companies operating in the country.

title: Electricity transmission system from Rantambe to Mahiyanganaya restored
byline: The 132-kilowatt electricity transmission system from Rantambe to Mahiyanganaya, which was damaged due to adverse weather conditions, has been restored.

title: Several families evacuated in Ruwanwella and Hatton over landslide risks
byline: A number of families residing in Ruwanwella, Ratthagala, in Kegalle district and the Rozella Manikkawatta colony in Hatton have been evacuated to safer locations due to the risk of possible landslides.

title: Passenger arrested at BIA while attempting to smuggle foreign cigarettes
byline: A passenger has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) by officers of the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) while attempting to smuggle a consignment of foreign-manufactured cigarettes into the country, this morning (07).

title: Special buses for Kandy–Colombo train passengers using season tickets from tomorrow
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has announced that special buses will be deployed tomorrow (08) morning for train passengers travelling from Kandy to Colombo.

title: Train season tickets valid on SLTB buses only in areas with suspended train services – SLTB
byline: The Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) has announced that passengers holding train monthly season tickets will be permitted to travel on SLTB buses only in areas where train services have been restricted or suspended.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Two US Air Force C-130J Super Hercules aircraft in Sri Lanka to support ongoing Cyclone Ditwah response
byline: U.S. Air Force Airmen in two C-130J Super Hercules aircraft deployed by U.S. Indo-Pacific Command to support Sri Lanka’s Cyclone Ditwah response.

title: Govt initiates measures to prepare Anuradhapura farmers for Maha season
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake instructed officials to prepare the farmers in the Anuradhapura District whose paddy cultivation was destroyed due to floods to re-cultivate during the upcoming Maha season.

title: Sri Lanka’s official reserve assets decrease further in November
byline: Sri Lanka’s official reserve assets have decreased by further 2.9% to US$ 6.033 billion in November 2025, compared to US$ 6.216 billion in October 2025, according to the Central Bank of Sri Lanka.

title: Over 4,500 houses destroyed in recent disaster, DMC confirms
byline: A total of 4,517 houses across the country have been destroyed due to recent landslides and floods, the Disaster Management Centre has confirmed.

title: Two arrested at BIA with 21kg of ‘Kush’ cannabis
byline: Two individuals have been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport while attempting to smuggle a stock of 21.582 kilograms of ‘Kush’ cannabis.

title: US envoy Kellogg says Ukraine peace deal is really close
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump’s outgoing Ukraine envoy said a deal to end the Ukraine war was “really close” and now depended on resolving two main outstanding issues: the future of Ukraine’s Donbas region and the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant.

title: “Aadaraya” programme launched to provide essential school items to children affected by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: “Aadaraya” programme, an initiative launched to distribute essential school items including books to children affected by cyclone Ditwah, got underway in Hambantota.

title: Sri Lanka’s death toll from adverse weather climbs to 627
byline: The death toll due to the adverse weather conditions experienced in the country over the past few days has climbed to 627, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) has confirmed.

title: Sergeant injured after accidental discharge of firearm inside Malabe Police Station
byline: A police sergeant has been injured in an accident caused by the accidental discharge of a firearm inside the Malabe Police Station.

title: Several access routes to Nuwara Eliya restored - District Secretary
byline: Several access routes to Nuwara Eliya have now been restored, according to Nuwara Eliya District Secretary Thushari Tennakoon.

title: PHIs uncover racket supplying flood-damaged rice to market in Kandy
byline: Public Health Inspectors (PHIs) have uncovered information about a racket in which flood-damaged rice was being processed and supplied to the market as consumable rice.

title: IMF to prioritise US$ 200 million Rapid Financing Instrument request made by Sri Lanka
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has decided to prioritise the US$ 200 million Rapid Financing Instrument (RFI) request made by Sri Lanka in a bid to tackle the challenges the country is facing following the devastation caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Kandy-Colombo road to remain open 24 hours for all vehicles from 4am tomorrow
byline: The Kandy-Colombo main road which was closed for vehicular traffic at Pahala Kadugannawa, will remain open around the clock for all vehicles from 4.00 am tomorrow (08), the RDA said.

title: Officials mull double track bridge to connect Peradeniya and Sarasavi Uyana stations
byline: The Department of Railways says it is focusing on developing the railway bridge over the Mahaweli River, located between Peradeniya and Sarasavi Uyana railway stations, as a double-track bridge.

title: President calls on Atamasthanadipathi Thero
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake called on the Atamasthanadhipathi, the Chief Sanghanayake of the Nuwara Kalaviya, Most Venerable Pallegama Hemarathana Nayake Thero, today (07), the President’s Media Division stated.

title: Permission granted to restore paddy fields severely damaged due to floods caused by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The Central Environmental Authority has already granted permission to remove sand and sand-mixed silt deposited in paddy fields that were severely damaged due to floods caused by Cyclone Ditwah, the Geological Survey and Mines Bureau stated.

title: Landslide evacuation warning issued to several areas in four districts extended
byline: The ‘Level-3’ (Red) landslide evacuation warning issued to multiple areas in four districts has been extended.

title: Superintendent injured during altercation within Boossa High Security Prison
byline: A Superintendent of the Boossa High Security Prison has sustained injuries following an altercation within the prison premises.

title: Showers predicted for Northern, North-Central, Eastern and Uva provinces
byline: The Northeast monsoon conditions are gradually establishing over the island, the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Ninth batch of disaster relief provided by UAE arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: The ninth batch of disaster relief provided by the United Arab Emirates to Sri Lanka arrived today (07) at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) aboard a special cargo aircraft belonging to the UAE Air Force.

title: Nearly 100,000 schoolchildren affected by adverse weather
byline: Nearly a thousand schools across nine provinces of the country have been affected, due to the adverse weather conditions, the Secretary to the Ministry of Education, Nalaka Kaluwewe noted.

title: Israeli PM Netanyahu to discuss second phase of Gaza plan with Trump later this month
byline: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday (Dec 7) that the second phase of a United States plan to end the war in Gaza was close, but cautioned several key issues still needed to be resolved, including whether a multinational security force would be deployed.

title: Health officials warn of potential disease outbreaks following recent flooding
byline: Attention must be paid to communicable diseases that may arise following the recent disaster situation in the country, the Epidemiology Unit has announced.

title: President stresses need for long-term plan to prevent mass-scale disasters from recurring
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has emphasised the importance for a long-term plan to prevent mass-scale natural disasters from recurring in future.
